property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={402, 348, 934, 632}, maximized=false}

property.name: text
property.value: Test FaceDetector module. ImageDisplay is for convenience.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: options
property.value: {"MinFaceSize": 50, "MaxFaceSize": 400}

property.name: description
property.value:
Try me! For 'input', enter /accessors/hosts/browser/demo/computerVision/terraswarmeyes.jpg then click 'react to inputs'.

A face detector accessor. This accessor detects faces in an input stream.

The options parameter can include the following fields:

  • value: The MinFaceSize and MaxFaceSize, which defaults to 50 and 400.

  • type: If set to 'JSON'

    The implementation for the Ptolemy II host uses https://opencv.org which is licensed under a BSD 3-clause license.

property.name: author
property.value: Ilge Akkaya. Contributor: Christopher Brooks

property.name: input (port)
property.value: A stream of images.

property.name: output (port)
property.value: The results of filtering the image according to the options

property.name: faceCount (port)
property.value: The number of faces

property.name: options (port)
property.value: The value and type options.

property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={521, 551, 421, 354}, maximized=false}

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Test accessor that spontaneously produces outputs once per time interval. This implementation produces a counting sequence.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks and Edward A. Lee. Based on TestSpontaneous by Edward A. Lee

property.name: output (port)
property.value: The output port

property.name: delay (parameter)
property.value: The delay in milliseconds before the value is outputk.

property.name: value (parameter)
property.value: The value to be output after the delay.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Compare the input with a known good input. If you set ''trainingMode'' to true and provide inputs, then the inputs will be recorded in the ''correctValues'' parameters. Otherwise, the inputs will be compared against those in the ''correctValue'' parameter.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks based on the Ptolemy NonStrictTest actor by Paul Whitaker, Christopher Hylands, Edward A. Lee

property.name: input (port)
property.value: The input value.

property.name: output (port)
property.value: False as long as there is data to compare against the input

note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor
